questions.question: Which statement best describes the main conflict in the story?

choices.answer: Maya’s brother is being bullied at school.
Maya needs permission to go to a school dance.
Maya’s family is struggling to earn enough money to live.
Maya has to do her mother’s job when her mother is injured.

questions.question: Maya is upset when she is called to the office because

choices.answer: she knows that her brother has been fighting.
she is worried about missing gymnastics..
she thinks it will be difficult to reach her father.
she thinks that she is in trouble

questions.question: Why does Maya give an incorrect translation of what the principal says about Nurzhan’s fight?

choices.answer: She wants to keep her father from becoming angry.
She misunderstands what the principal says.
She thinks Nurzhan was right to defend himself.
She needs Nurzhan’s help to go to a dance.

questions.question: One reason Maya’s parents have stricter rules than her friends’ parents is that her parents

choices.answer: have to work long hours at their jobs.
expect her to do well in school.
are from a country with different customs.
want her to set a good example for her brother.

questions.question: Nurzhan helps to resolve the story’s conflict by

choices.answer: saying that things are different in America.
offering to be Maya’s chaperone.
standing up to a school bully.
signing Maya’s permission slip.

questions.question: What does Mama do to show that she understands that growing up in America is different?

choices.answer: She defends Maya when the family’s dinner burns.
She treats Nurzhan and Maya differently.
She gives Maya a special bracelet to wear to the dance.
She insists that Nurzhan will be Maya’s chaperone.
to shock someone
to do well on a test
to create a lot of noise
to receive a gift
a promise
a fight
a rule
a chair
a joyful shout
a loud ringing
a soft cry
a sudden boom

questions.question: The job of a dispatcher is to

choices.answer: drive vehicles such as taxi cabs.
send out vehicles according to a schedule.
help children contact their parents.
convince people to ride in a taxi.
